text: Hello everyone. I have built a custom product module that has multiple additions per page. It has a tabbed section with JavaScript. If I add the module in multiple places in the page, the top tabs work but the bottom tabs don't. I think it's an issue with not having a unique ID for the tabbed section ("ID attribute values must be unique"). Any ideas on how to give that section a unique ID? Perhaps pull in the HubSpot module number into the id or html?
I'm figuring it out. It has to do with the way I set up the for loop that is pulling data together.

Hey Michael, I canâ€™t say for sure without looking at the JS code, but my suspicion would be that it's only selecting and manipulating the first instance of the module. One way to get around this is by refactoring the JS code into a `require_js` block within the HTML window and referencing the `name` variable, which is unique for each module instance.
I am pretty sure that is happening. I've been researching how to genreate a unique ID with Math.random() but not sure that is the coorrect path. Thank you though! I'll try this first.
I see what you are saying now! I was wondering how to do that earlier! Thank you!
